newsitem.title: GERMANY: Preussag sales declined in quarter.
newsitem.headline: Preussag sales declined in quarter.

text.p: Diversified German industrial group Preussag AG said on Wednesday its external sales declined slightly to 6.348 billion marks ($4.3 billion) in the quarter to June 30 from 6.354 billion in the year-earlier quarter.
Sales fell to 17.921 billion marks in the first nine months of the company's business year, which ends on September 30, from 18.350 billion in the year-earlier period.

Incoming orders in the quarter rose 27 percent to 8.1 billion marks, fuelled mainly by trade and a large ship order. Nine-month orders were 20.8 billion marks, a shade above the 20.7 billion marks a year earlier.
Orders on hand were 14.3 billion marks, up 11 percent.
"Preussag turned in a satisfactory performance in the third quarter of 1995/96, given that the business environment, particularly in steel, remained difficult," the company said in a statement.
Total sales rose slightly to 7.2 billion marks in the quarter from 7.1 billion marks a year earlier.
-- Terence Gallagher, Bonn newsroom, 49 228 26097150 ($ = 1.483 German Marks)
